input:
Genoa 3 - 0 AC

First Half:

13:14 Event: Indirect free-kick by Genoa
13:27 Event: Ball out of play
13:31 Caption: Genoa try to maintain the tempo of the game by taking a quick free kick.

13:54 Event: Ball out of play
14:04 Event: Throw-in by AC
14:16 Event: Ball out of play
14:27 Caption: Keisuke Honda (AC Milan) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to AC Milan.
14:38 Event: Corner by AC
14:43 Caption: Keisuke Honda (AC Milan) steps up to take the corner. He launches the ball into the penalty area, but it only finds the head of an opposing player who clears the danger.
14:49 Event: Ball out of play

15:46 Caption: Manuel Locatelli (AC Milan) trips an opposition player and Luca Banti signals a foul.
15:52 Event: Indirect free-kick by Genoa
16:09 Event: Foul by Genoa
16:17 Event: Indirect free-kick by AC
16:56 Caption: A long cross from the side is directed to the well-positioned M'Baye Niang (AC Milan), but the defence gets it clear.
17:54 Event: Ball out of play
18:11 Caption: Edenilson (Genoa) did his best to latch on to a crossfield pass, but it was too long and it goes out of play. The ball goes out of play and AC Milan will have a goal kick.
18:17 Event: Clearance by AC
19:04 Caption: Diego Laxalt (Genoa) sends a beautiful cross into the penalty area, but the opposition's defence manages to clear the ball to safety.
19:41 Event: Offside by Genoa
19:49 Caption: Giovanni Simeone (Genoa) is caught offside!
19:58 Event: Indirect free-kick by AC
20:24 Event: Ball out of play
20:32 Caption: M'Baye Niang (AC Milan) found some space to dink a cross from the side into the box, but it needed to be more precise to threaten the opposition.
20:50 Event: Clearance by Genoa
21:40 Event: Shots off target by AC
21:41 Event: Ball out of play
21:50 Caption: Lovely skill from Alessio Romagnoli (AC Milan) as he gets away from defenders and unleashes a shot from 24 metres out, but his effort goes just wide of the left post.
22:09 Event: Clearance by Genoa
22:21 Event: Foul by AC
22:31 Caption: Luca Banti blows his whistle after Manuel Locatelli (AC Milan) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle.
22:46 Event: Indirect free-kick by Genoa
23:00 Event: Foul by Genoa
23:13 Event: Indirect free-kick by AC
23:13 Caption: The referee blows his whistle as Miguel Veloso (Genoa) was too aggressive in his challenge.
23:33 Event: Foul by Genoa
23:59 Caption: Luca Rigoni (Genoa) commits a foul after making a slide tackle on his opponent. Free kick. AC Milan will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
24:18 Event: Direct free-kick by AC
24:29 Caption: Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) puts a cross into the box from the free kick but it's cleared.
24:49 Event: Shots on target by AC
24:59 Caption: Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, but it goes straight at Mattia Perin.
25:42 Caption: Giovanni Simeone (Genoa) sends a cross into the box, but Gianluigi Donnarumma comes off his line to gather the ball.
26:25 Event: Foul by Genoa
26:41 Caption: A clumsy foul by Miguel Veloso (Genoa) and Luca Banti blows his whistle.
27:35 Event: Indirect free-kick by AC
27:41 Event: Ball out of play
27:45 Event: Throw-in by AC
27:55 Event: Ball out of play

29:15 Event: Ball out of play
29:19 Event: Throw-in by AC
29:46 Caption: Neat passing move from AC Milan in order to create new attacking opportunities.
30:07 Caption: Edenilson (Genoa) tries to create a chance, but puts too much weight on his pass.
30:38 Event: Ball out of play
30:53 Event: Throw-in by Genoa
31:45 Event: Ball out of play
31:57 Event: Throw-in by Genoa
32:19 Event: Shots on target by AC
32:35 Caption: Andrea Poli (AC Milan) connects with a pass but sees his shot from the edge of the box blocked.
34:52 Caption: The AC Milan players are exchanging fine passes and are waiting for an opportunity to start an attack, but here's a mistake and a loss of possession.
36:21 Event: Ball out of play
36:24 Event: Throw-in by AC
37:49 Event: Foul by AC
37:59 Caption: The AC Milan players keep the ball and are exchanging a combination of passes. They are waiting for gaps in the defence to open up.
38:04 Event: Indirect free-kick by Genoa
38:28 Event: Foul by Genoa
38:42 Event: Indirect free-kick by AC
39:19 Event: Foul by Genoa
39:23 Event: Yellow card by Genoa
39:50 Caption: Armando Izzo (Genoa) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Luca Banti ignores the protests.
40:16 Event: Direct free-kick by AC
40:18 Event: Foul by AC
40:51 Event: Indirect free-kick by Genoa
41:07 Event: Shots off target by AC
41:08 Event: Ball out of play
41:15 Caption: M'Baye Niang (AC Milan) got the ball on the edge of the box and fired in a first-time shot on goal, but his effort floated well over the bar. High, wide and not at all handsome.
41:32 Event: Clearance by Genoa
42:19 Event: Ball out of play
42:29 Caption: A lofted cross from Miguel Veloso (Genoa) is unsuccessful as the opponent's defence quickly clears the ball out of the penalty area. Genoa will take a corner kick.
43:06 Event: Corner by Genoa
43:09 Event: Foul by Genoa
43:19 Event: Indirect free-kick by AC
43:21 Caption: Nikola Ninkovic (Genoa) fails to produce a decent cross from the corner kick. The ball goes well out of play.
43:52 Event: Ball out of play
44:00 Event: Throw-in by AC
44:07 Event: Foul by Genoa
44:34 Caption: A player from Genoa pulled an opponent down, forcing the referee to blow his whistle. AC Milan are awarded the free kick.
44:50 Event: Direct free-kick by AC
46:13 Caption: That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
46:59 Caption: We can hope that the managers will be able to motivate the players and stir them to improve their performance for after the half-time break. We haven't seen really exciting football in the previous 45 minutes. Both teams are unsuccessfully trying to control the game and it's pretty even so far. Both sides are using the same slow build-up play tactic.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Genoa
00:00 Caption: Fourth official shows 1 min. of added time.
00:00 Caption: Keisuke Honda (AC Milan) floats the free kick into the box, but it's easily cleared by the first man.
00:01 Caption: Referee Luca Banti blows his whistle to start the second half.
00:42 Caption: Carlos Bacca (AC Milan) does his best to latch onto a cross into the box, but he can't get to the ball.
01:09 Event: Shots off target by AC
01:11 Event: Ball out of play
01:19 Caption: The effort by Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) failed to give the goalkeeper anything to worry about. He unleashed a poor shot from 26 metres which flew well wide of the right post.
01:35 Event: Clearance by Genoa
02:05 Event: Ball out of play
02:13 Caption: Gabriel Paletta (AC Milan) is unable to feed an accurate cross into the box.
02:33 Event: Clearance by Genoa
03:06 Event: Offside by Genoa
03:15 Caption: The linesman raises his flag for offside before Luca Rigoni (Genoa) heads on.
03:20 Event: Indirect free-kick by AC
05:06 Event: Shots off target by AC
05:07 Event: Ball out of play
05:15 Caption: Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 23 metres out. Mattia Perin stops the effort which is headed for the bottom left corner. Good work from AC Milan as they win a corner.
05:43 Event: Corner by AC
05:49 Event: Shots on target by AC
05:54 Caption: M'Baye Niang (AC Milan) takes the corner kick and sends a lovely ball into the penalty area, but the opposition's defence is ready and knocks the ball to safety.
05:58 Caption: Gabriel Paletta (AC Milan) blasts the ball from just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by the defender.
07:38 Event: Ball out of play
08:40 Event: Substitution by Genoa
08:47 Caption: The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nikola Ninkovic trots off the pitch and is replaced by Darko Lazovic (Genoa).
08:52 Event: Throw-in by Genoa
09:39 Event: Ball out of play
09:50 Caption: Darko Lazovic (Genoa) tries to send a pass but it's blocked. The ball is out of play. Genoa will have a chance to score from a corner.
10:09 Caption: Darko Lazovic (Genoa) puts a dangerous cross into the box, but the corner is cleared by the first man.
10:13 Event: Corner by Genoa
10:39 Event: Foul by AC
10:46 Event: Red card by AC
10:59 Caption: Luca Banti shows a red card with no hesitation. Gabriel Paletta (AC Milan) can have an early bath and think about his challenge.
12:15 Event: Substitution by AC
12:25 Caption: Substitution. Gustavo Gomez (AC Milan) in, Carlos Bacca out.
12:45 Event: Direct free-kick by Genoa
13:38 Caption: Andrea Poli (AC Milan) sends a cross into the box, but the opposition's defence quickly intercepts the ball.
14:52 Event: Ball out of play
14:53 Caption: Luca Rigoni (Genoa) flights in the cross, but the defender is alert and clears to safety. The ball goes out of play and Genoa have been awarded a corner kick.
15:21 Event: Corner by Genoa
15:31 Event: Shots on target by Genoa
15:32 Caption: Darko Lazovic (Genoa) sends a wonderful cross from the corner kick. However, the defence works perfectly to clear the ball and avert the threat.
16:15 Event: Substitution by AC
16:38 Caption: Vincenzo Montella has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Luiz Adriano (AC Milan) replacing Keisuke Honda.
17:22 Event: Ball out of play
17:48 Event: Throw-in by Genoa
18:17 Event: Ball out of play
18:17 Caption: Some neat passing and movement from AC Milan as they ping around some short passes in order to create a new attacking opportunity.
18:46 Event: Clearance by Genoa
19:16 Event: Ball out of play
19:30 Caption: M'Baye Niang (AC Milan) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away. The ball is out of play and AC Milan manage to earn a corner.
19:41 Event: Corner by AC
19:44 Caption: M'Baye Niang (AC Milan) floats the ball in from the corner but it's intercepted.
20:44 Event: Foul by AC
20:53 Caption: Juraj Kucka (AC Milan) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Luca Banti blows his whistle for a foul.
21:21 Event: Substitution by Genoa
21:37 Event: Indirect free-kick by Genoa
21:40 Event: Ball out of play
21:43 Caption: The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leonardo Pavoletti (Genoa) comes onto the pitch for Giovanni Simeone.
21:49 Event: Throw-in by AC
22:30 Event: Shots off target by Genoa
22:30 Event: Ball out of play
22:39 Caption: Good team movement sets up Tomas Rincon (Genoa) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
22:47 Event: Clearance by AC
23:01 Event: Ball out of play
23:09 Caption: Darko Lazovic (Genoa) passes the ball from the edge of the box in order to find his teammate, who is in a good scoring position, but the defender blocks the pass and spanks the ball to safety. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Genoa.
23:31 Event: Corner by Genoa
23:40 Caption: Darko Lazovic (Genoa) swings in the corner, but it's comfortably cleared away.
24:01 Event: Ball out of play
24:04 Event: Throw-in by AC
24:20 Event: Ball out of play
24:27 Caption: M'Baye Niang (AC Milan) found some space to play in a lofted pass, but he looks disappointed as none of his teammates managed to connect with it. It's a throw-in for Genoa.
24:40 Event: Substitution by AC
24:53 Event: Throw-in by Genoa
24:55 Caption: Suso (AC Milan) joins the action as a substitute, replacing M'Baye Niang.
24:58 Event: Ball out of play
25:10 Event: Throw-in by AC
25:54 Caption: Suso (AC Milan) slides a pass forward, but one of the defenders cuts it out.
26:04 Event: Ball out of play
26:15 Event: Clearance by AC
26:25 Caption: Leonardo Pavoletti (Genoa) attempts to test the goalkeeper after receiving a cross inside the penalty area. He hits the ball poorly and his shot goes well wide of the right post.
27:23 Caption: Half-chance! Suso (AC Milan) plays a pass into the box, but Mattia Perin reacts well to snuff out the attack.
28:18 Event: Shots on target by AC
28:26 Caption: Juraj Kucka (AC Milan) attempts to score from 24 metres out, but his decent effort flies towards the middle of the target and is stopped by Mattia Perin. It didn't really trouble him.
28:33 Event: Foul by Genoa
28:37 Event: Yellow card by Genoa
28:53 Caption: Luca Banti shows a yellow card to Leonardo Pavoletti (Genoa) for a tough tackle.
29:26 Event: Indirect free-kick by AC
29:34 Event: Shots off target by AC
29:34 Event: Ball out of play
29:56 Event: Clearance by Genoa
30:26 Caption: AC Milan hold the ball and are exchanging some long passes.
30:52 Caption: Suso (AC Milan) hammers the ball goalwards from about 23 metres. The shot is directed low to the middle of the target but is thwarted by a save from Mattia Perin.
30:58 Event: Shots on target by AC
31:32 Event: Foul by Genoa
32:14 Event: Substitution by Genoa
32:26 Event: Indirect free-kick by AC
32:30 Event: Ball out of play
32:36 Caption: The substitution has been made. Riccardo Fiamozzi (Genoa) has replaced Edenilson.
32:52 Event: Clearance by Genoa
33:02 Event: Ball out of play
33:04 Event: Throw-in by AC
33:39 Event: Ball out of play
33:48 Event: Throw-in by AC
34:08 Event: Shots off target by Genoa
34:09 Event: Goal by Genoa
34:13 Caption: This is definitely not what Juraj Kucka (AC Milan) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 2:0.
35:02 Event: Kick-off by AC
36:32 Event: Shots on target by Genoa
36:42 Caption: Miguel Veloso (Genoa) gets on the end of a pass and takes a low shot from the edge of the box which is straight at Gianluigi Donnarumma, who makes a comfortable save.
37:05 Event: Foul by Genoa
37:11 Caption: 46:54 – the ratio of ball possession. The current number of shots on goal is 3:3.
38:10 Event: Direct free-kick by AC
38:11 Event: Shots off target by AC
38:12 Event: Ball out of play
38:35 Event: Clearance by Genoa
38:50 Caption: Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) unleashes a shot from 23 metres out but is unable to find the target and it goes high over the crossbar.
38:55 Event: Foul by Genoa
38:58 Event: Yellow card by Genoa
39:29 Caption: Miguel Veloso (Genoa) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Luca Banti didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
39:38 Event: Direct free-kick by AC
40:32 Event: Shots on target by Genoa
40:32 Event: Goal by Genoa
40:58 Caption: Leonardo Pavoletti (Genoa) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Gianluigi Donnarumma with a strike into the right side of the goal. He makes it 3:0.
41:35 Event: Kick-off by AC
42:06 Event: Ball out of play
42:11 Event: Throw-in by AC
42:51 Caption: Genoa are showcasing great team work and neat passing moves.
43:42 Event: Offside by Genoa
43:59 Caption: Luca Rigoni (Genoa) has a goal ruled out for offside!
44:05 Event: Indirect free-kick by AC
44:34 Event: Ball out of play
44:52 Event: Throw-in by Genoa
44:57 Event: Ball out of play
46:11 Caption: Ezequiel Munoz (Genoa) sends a cross into the box, but the opposition's defence clears the ball to safety. The ball goes out for a corner. Genoa can continue in their attacking effort.
47:01 Caption: Genoa quickly take a corner kick with a short pass.
47:53 Caption: Diego Laxalt (Genoa) clearly holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows his whistle for a foul.
48:14 Caption: The match has just finished.
48:59 Caption: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. The home side dominated this game. Both teams attempted to play possession football.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The stage was set for an intriguing clash as Genoa hosted AC Milan in a match filled with twists and turns, set against the scenic backdrop of a fervently energetic Italian crowd. The anticipation in the stadium was palpable when the referee blew the opening whistle to commence the first half at 00:00, signalling AC Milan to kick off proceedings.

From the outset, it was clear that both teams were eager to impose themselves on the game. By 00:51, the ball was already out of play, showcasing the intensity and early engagement from both sets of players. Genoa quickly established a defensive mindset with a solid clearance coming their way at 01:14, indicative of their readiness to thwart any early threats from AC Milan.

The initial minutes of the match witnessed numerous interruptions; the ball wandered out of play several times between the 01:54 and 07:25 mark. Throw-ins and clearances from both sides dominated the flow, portraying a game struggling to find rhythm. Onlookers hoped for a breakthrough, and just past the nine-minute mark, Genoa's persistent efforts bore fruit.

In the 10th minute, a moment of sheer brilliance illuminated the pitch. Genoa's Tomas Rincon delivered an impeccably placed cross into AC Milan’s penalty area. Nikola Ninkovic, rising majestically, met the ball with precision and finesse, planting his header into the bottom left corner of the net. This was their first shot on target, and what a productive one it was! Gianluigi Donnarumma, despite his reflexes, found himself helpless against the execution of this stunning goal, which pushed Genoa ahead at 10:23.

In the frenetic minutes that followed Genoa's opening goal, AC Milan looked to regain momentum. They kicked off from the center at 11:10, but the resurgence was immediately met with disruption as the ball went out of play. AC Milan’s possession saw intermittent bursts of promise, such as attempts from players like Keisuke Honda, who orchestrated a corner at the 14:27 mark, and Giacomo Bonaventura, who unleashed a powerful strike from the edge of the box.

By the 21st minute, AC Milan was desperately seeking an equalizer. Their efforts were highlighted by Alessio Romagnoli’s skillful maneuver past Genoa's defenders, culminating in a shot that narrowly missed the left post. Though the score didn’t change, the action hinted at AC Milan's persistent spirit.

The physicality of the game didn't lag either, with several fouls disrupting the fluidity of play. Referee Luca Banti’s whistle frequently halted the match to mediate the numerous infringements. In fact, tensions reached a crescendo in the 39th minute when Armando Izzo of Genoa earned a yellow card for his aggressive tackle — a testament to the fierce competitiveness on display.

As the first half drew closer to its end, AC Milan tried to craft opportunities through their possession, yet Genoa's defense consistently thwarted their advances. Diego Laxalt and Edenilson of Genoa worked tirelessly to suppress AC Milan's forays into their territory. By the halftime whistle at 46:13, Genoa held a slim but hard-fought 1-0 lead, setting the stage for a captivating second half.

The second half began with Genoa resuming play at 00:00. Both teams hoped to find a rhythm that eluded them in the first half. However, the rigorous contest from the first half spilled over; AC Milan continued their offensive ambitions through efforts like Giacomo Bonaventura's long shot in the 01:19 mark. Despite their intentions and an increasing number of shots, AC Milan struggled to convert their advances into tangible results.

In a dramatic turn at around the 10-minute mark, Gabriel Paletta of AC Milan saw red. An egregious challenge prompted the referee to brandish the red card. This sent AC Milan down to ten men, adding to their woes and giving Genoa a numerical advantage.

The red card incident seemed to galvanize both teams into making pivotal changes. Genoa substituted Nikola Ninkovic with Darko Lazovic at 08:40, hoping the fresh legs would sustain their dominance. AC Milan, realizing the necessity for a defensive reorganization, brought on Gustavo Gomez to fill the void left by Carlos Bacca.

Genoa's strategy bore fruit in the 34th minute when another defensive mishap from AC Milan culminated in an own goal by Juraj Kucka. Attempting to cut off a pass, Kucka inadvertently directed the ball into his own net, doubling Genoa's lead. Now trailing 2-0, AC Milan felt the pressure mounting insurmountably.

A spirited Genoa side kept the pressure on, hitting the target several more times before finally sealing the fate of the match with a third goal. In the 40:58 mark of the half, Leonardo Pavoletti epitomized Genoa's determination. Capitalizing on a moment of brilliance, Pavoletti embarked on a solo run, dispatching a precise shot beyond Donnarumma into the right side of the goal. This striking finish elevated the score to 3-0, rendering a comeback increasingly improbable for AC Milan.

Amid their dominance, Genoa's discipline was tested; Miguel Veloso and Leonardo Pavoletti both found themselves in the referee's book with yellow cards for their challenges. Nonetheless, Genoa's control of the game was evident in their fluid teamwork and well-coordinated passes.

In the dying stages of the game, AC Milan made valiant attempts to salvage some pride. Shots off target, deflected crosses, and resilient Genoa defending encapsulated AC Milan’s frustrating evening. Genoa, unfazed, continued their composed display, maintaining possession and effectively nullifying AC Milan's offenses.

The game concluded with Genoa comfortably claiming a 3-0 victory. Celebrations ensued as the home fans rejoiced at witnessing a comprehensive performance from their team. The final whistle at 48:14 confirmed a dominant display by Genoa, which was graced by tactical discipline, effective use of set-pieces, and ironclad defending.

Reflecting on the match, Genoa’s approach was replete with disciplined defense, clinical finishing, and capitalizing on AC Milan's errors. Meanwhile, AC Milan's evening was marred by inefficiency in front of goal, critical defensive lapses, culminating in a frustrating red card which further skewed the advantage towards Genoa.

Both teams evidently strived to play possession football; however, Genoa's execution proved superior. Their ability to transition swiftly from defense to attack and maintaining robust defensive tenacity underlined their dominance. Meanwhile, AC Milan, despite showing sparks of their capabilities, found themselves overpowered by Genoa's efficient gameplay and couldn't compensate for the numerical disadvantage post-Paletta's red card.

In conclusion, this match served as a testament to Genoa’s tactical acumen and clinical finishing. The journey through two moments of brilliance and an unfortunate own goal encapsulated a thrilling encounter. AC Milan, imbued with lessons from this harsh defeat, would invariably look to regroup and refine their strategies in pursuit of future victories. As fans streamed out of the stadium and the lights dimmed, Genoa's emphatic 3-0 victory etched an unforgettable chapter in their season, stamping their mark as formidable contenders in the league.
